title: How to Create Japanese Style Buildings in Minecraft

steps.title: Start by building a foundation for your house.
steps.content: Start by building a foundation for your house. Place a 3x4 rectangle of oak logs. There should be a three-block gap between each log. Fill in the rectangle with oak wood planks. Place a ring of oak wood planks around the outside of the rectangle. Place a ring of oak wood slabs around the outside. Replace the corners with full blocks.

steps.title: Place 3 oak wood logs on top of each log in the foundation.
steps.content: Place 3 oak wood logs on top of each log in the foundation. These pillars will form the basics of the walls.

steps.title: Place three oak fence posts on the corners.
steps.content: Place three oak fence posts on the corners. These will act as roof supports.

steps.title: Use wool to create an outline of where your roof will go.
steps.content: Use wool to create an outline of where your roof will go. The roof is one of the hardest parts, and can make or break a build. Once you've practiced a bit, you can do this without the outline.

steps.title: Create a plan of how your roof will be formed.
steps.content: Create a plan of how your roof will be formed. Try to curve it towards the top. The red lines are at one-block gaps, so you can see how to place the blocks.

steps.title: Extend the bottom layer of the roof plan into a rectangle.
steps.content: Extend the bottom layer of the roof plan into a rectangle. Swap the four corner slabs for full blocks.

steps.title: Build the next layer of the plan into a rectangle.
steps.content: Build the next layer of the plan into a rectangle. Make sure that it is nested inside the first layer.

steps.title: Extend the third layer into a rectangle.
steps.content: Extend the third layer into a rectangle.

steps.title: Add the fourth layer.
steps.content: Add the fourth layer. For this layer, just build the long sides of the rectangle, and not the short sides. Note that they extend out onto the third layer.

steps.title: Extend the remaining layers out into strips, like the fourth layer.
steps.content: Extend the remaining layers out into strips, like the fourth layer.

steps.title: Fill in the space in between the top layers of the roof, to create an alcove.
steps.content: Fill in the space in between the top layers of the roof, to create an alcove. Repeat at the opposite end of the roof.

steps.title: Add a couple of oak wood steps to each end of the top of the roof.
steps.content: Add a couple of oak wood steps to each end of the top of the roof. This improves the appearance.

steps.title: Go underneath the roof, and fill in the gap between the roof and the pillars with oak wood planks.
steps.content: Go underneath the roof, and fill in the gap between the roof and the pillars with oak wood planks.

steps.title: Fill in the inside ridge of the roof.
steps.content: Fill in the inside ridge of the roof. This creates a flatter ceiling inside your building.

steps.title: Use glowstone to light it up.
steps.content: Use glowstone to light it up. Don't want mobs spawning inside!

steps.title: Fill in the spaces between the pillars with white stained glass panes.
steps.content: Fill in the spaces between the pillars with white stained glass panes. Remember to leave a gap in one of them for the door.

steps.title: Use white stained glass panes to partition the inside of the building, if desired.
steps.content: Use white stained glass panes to partition the inside of the building, if desired.

steps.title: Create the framework of the foundation.
steps.content: Create the framework of the foundation. Place a six by six square of oak wood logs, with a 3 block gap in between each one.

steps.title: Place an oak wood log in the center of the square.
steps.content: Place an oak wood log in the center of the square. this will form the central pillar of the building.

steps.title: Fill in the space between the logs with oak wood planks.
steps.content: Fill in the space between the logs with oak wood planks. Also, place a ring of oak wood planks, then a ring of oak wood slabs, around the outside of the square of logs.

steps.title: Place three oak wood logs on top of each log in the foundation.
steps.content: Place three oak wood logs on top of each log in the foundation.

steps.title: Place a ring of oak wood planks around the top of the pillars.
steps.content: Place a ring of oak wood planks around the top of the pillars.

steps.title: Place white stained glass panes between the logs.
steps.content: Place white stained glass panes between the logs. Leave a hole in one for the doorway.

steps.title: Place a ring of oak wood slabs around the ring on top of the pillars.
steps.content: Place a ring of oak wood slabs around the ring on top of the pillars.

steps.title: Place a second ring of oak wood slabs around the one you just made.
steps.content: Place a second ring of oak wood slabs around the one you just made. Swap out the corners for full blocks.

steps.title: Create a guide as to where the next layers of the roof will go.
steps.content: Create a guide as to where the next layers of the roof will go.

steps.title: Expand each of the blocks in the guide to a full square.
steps.content: Expand each of the blocks in the guide to a full square. Each square should be nested inside the others.

steps.title: Build up the central pillar so that it is level with the roof.
steps.content: Build up the central pillar so that it is level with the roof.

steps.title: Fill in the roof with oak wood planks.
steps.content: Fill in the roof with oak wood planks. This will form the floor of the next layer.

steps.title: Place a ring of pillars of oak wood logs on the floor that you just filled in.
steps.content: Place a ring of pillars of oak wood logs on the floor that you just filled in.

steps.title: Build up the central pillar.
steps.content: Build up the central pillar.

steps.title: Place a ring of oak wood planks around the tops of the pillars.
steps.content: Place a ring of oak wood planks around the tops of the pillars.

steps.title: Fill in the spaces between the pillars with white stained glass panes.
steps.content: Fill in the spaces between the pillars with white stained glass panes.

steps.title: Create a guide for where the next roof will go.
steps.content: Create a guide for where the next roof will go.

steps.title: Expand each layer of the guide into a square.
steps.content: Expand each layer of the guide into a square. Swap out the corners for full blocks.

steps.title: Build up the central pillar.
steps.content: Build up the central pillar.

steps.title: Fill in the floor.
steps.content: Fill in the floor.

steps.title: Build a three-block high pillar of oak wood logs at each corner of the new layer.
steps.content: Build a three-block high pillar of oak wood logs at each corner of the new layer.

steps.title: Create a circle of planks around the top.
steps.content: Create a circle of planks around the top.

steps.title: Fill in the sides with white stained glass panes.
steps.content: Fill in the sides with white stained glass panes.

steps.title: Build a guide for where the roof will go.
steps.content: Build a guide for where the roof will go. This is the final roof, so it is a bit steeper than the others.

steps.title: Turn the guide into a full roof.
steps.content: Turn the guide into a full roof. You know the drill by now...

steps.title: Use oak wood fence posts to create a finial on the top.
steps.content: Use oak wood fence posts to create a finial on the top.

steps.title: Light up the inside with glowstone.
steps.content: Light up the inside with glowstone.

steps.title: Build a ladder up the central pillar to reach the other floors.
steps.content: Build a ladder up the central pillar to reach the other floors.

steps.title: Done!
steps.content: Done!

steps.title: Use wool to build a guide to where each layer will go.
steps.content: Use wool to build a guide to where each layer will go. The bottom layer should be five blocks high, and the other five layers should be four high. Each layer should shrink inwards by one block on the long side, and one or two blocks on the short side.

steps.title: Fill in the bottom layer with cobblestone.
steps.content: Fill in the bottom layer with cobblestone. This forms the foundation of your castle.

steps.title: Build a guide as to where the foundation will be extended outwards.
steps.content: Build a guide as to where the foundation will be extended outwards. The inner layer should be 3.5 blocks high, and the outer should be 1.5 blocks.

steps.title: Extend the guide outwards to increase the width of the foundation.
steps.content: Extend the guide outwards to increase the width of the foundation.

steps.title: Build the roof and walls for each layer.
steps.content: Build the roof and walls for each layer. The floor will be made of the roof of the layer below.

steps.title: Go to the top of the building, and create a guide as to where the roof will go.
steps.content: Go to the top of the building, and create a guide as to where the roof will go.

steps.title: Build the guide out into a roof.
steps.content: Build the guide out into a roof.

steps.title: Build a ring around the base of the top level.
steps.content: Build a ring around the base of the top level.

steps.title: Add two lines of blocks to the top of the long sides of the next level down.
steps.content: Add two lines of blocks to the top of the long sides of the next level down.

steps.title: Add two rings of slabs to finish the roof of the second level.
steps.content: Add two rings of slabs to finish the roof of the second level.

steps.title: Add a small rooflet to each side of the second level.
steps.content: Add a small rooflet to each side of the second level. This step is optional and purely cosmetic, but it does enhance how your building looks.

steps.title: Place two slabs on the third level.
steps.content: Place two slabs on the third level. These will be a guide to where the roof will be built.

steps.title: Build two rings of slabs around the third level.
steps.content: Build two rings of slabs around the third level.

steps.title: Build a rooflet on the short sides of the third level roof, if desired.
steps.content: Build a rooflet on the short sides of the third level roof, if desired.

steps.title: Build two rooflets if desired.
steps.content: Build two rooflets if desired. Add them on the long sides of the third level, beneath and to the side of the rooflet on the second level.

steps.title: Remove a row of blocks at the top of each of the short sides on the fourth level.
steps.content: Remove a row of blocks at the top of each of the short sides on the fourth level.

steps.title: Place a row of blocks just below the cut-out on the long sides of the fourth level.
steps.content: Place a row of blocks just below the cut-out on the long sides of the fourth level.

steps.title: Build two rings of slabs to finish off the roof of the fourth level.
steps.content: Build two rings of slabs to finish off the roof of the fourth level.

steps.title: Build two rings of slabs around the bottom level to complete the roofing of the castle.
steps.content: Build two rings of slabs around the bottom level to complete the roofing of the castle.

steps.title: Go to the top of the roof and build a row of fence posts, if desired.
steps.content: Go to the top of the roof and build a row of fence posts, if desired.

steps.title: Add an optional edging.
steps.content: Add an optional edging. Replace the edges of the roof with a different-coloured block, such as spruce or dark oak. This helps the features of the building to stand out.

steps.title: Make a hole in the front as a door, and build a staircase leading up to it.
steps.content: Make a hole in the front as a door, and build a staircase leading up to it.

steps.title: Light up the inside of the building.
steps.content: Light up the inside of the building.

steps.title: Build a staircase between every level.
steps.content: Build a staircase between every level. Make sure that you replace any lights that the staircase covers up, to prevent mobs from spawning.

steps.title: Place holes in the walls as windows and arrow slits.
steps.content: Place holes in the walls as windows and arrow slits.

steps.title: Finished!
steps.content: Finished!

steps.title: Build gravel paths between your buildings.
steps.content: Build gravel paths between your buildings. A simple step, but it does help.

steps.title: Build a stone pagoda.
steps.content: Build a stone pagoda. Stone pagodas are much more compact than wooden pagodas. Building one with five layers looks good, but in real life they can have as many as sixteen layers. A stone pagoda works well as a focal point, for example at a crossroads.

steps.title: Build a torii gate.
steps.content: Build a torii gate. In real life, these are usually found at the entrances to Shinto shrines. They can serve to draw your attention towards a particular path or building.

steps.title: Build toro lanterns along the pathways.
steps.content: Build toro lanterns along the pathways. Like torii, toro are usually found in Shinto shrines. They serve to illuminate the pathways, and in Minecraft, keep the mobs away.

steps.title: Plant oak trees around your buildings.
steps.content: Plant oak trees around your buildings. Swap the leaves for white or pink wool to create cherry trees, and for yellow/orange terracotta and red/brown wool to create autumn trees.
